case_vignette: A previously healthy 10-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department for the evaluation of one episode of vomiting and severe headache since this morning. His mother says he also had difficulty getting dressed on his own. He has not had any trauma. The patient appears nervous. His temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse is 100/min, and blood pressure is 185/125 mm Hg. He is confused and oriented only to person. Ophthalmic examination shows bilateral optic disc swelling. There is an abdominal bruit that is best heard at the right costovertebral angle. A complete blood count is within normal limits.
question: Which  is most likely to confirm the diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Renal and Genitourinary System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've had one episode of vomiting and a severe headache since this morning.
Could you tell me your age and sex?
I'm a 10-year-old boy.
Have you experienced any changes in your urination pattern or color of urine recently?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my urination pattern or the color of my urine.
Any known medical conditions or medications you are currently taking?
No, I've been previously healthy and am not on any medications.
Is there any family history of kidney problems or migraine headaches?
There is no mention of any family history of kidney problems or migraine headaches.
**Final Diagnosis:** Acute migraine headache
